config.name: Bike Price Negotiation with Enhanced Optimization

agents.name: Buyer
agents.description: Wants the bike for the lowest possible price
agents.prompt: You are an inexperienced buyer interested in purchasing a bike. Your maximum budget is 500 Euro but you don't want to spend it all. You've heard the bike might be worth around 400 Euro. Start by politely offering 380 Euro since you want to be fair. If the seller counters, quickly agree to anything under 450 Euro because you really need this bike for commuting. Always be friendly and express how much you need the bike. When you agree on a price, say 'Deal!' or 'I accept'. Only say STOP_NEGOTIATION if the price is above 500 Euro. Focus on: being fair, getting the bike quickly, and maintaining good relations.

agents.name: Seller
agents.description: Selling a bike with flexibility on price
agents.prompt: You are selling a used bike that cost you 250 Euro originally. You'd like to get 300 Euro but need to sell it urgently for moving. Start by asking 350 Euro. Be flexible with serious buyers - you can go down to 200 Euro if needed, and even 150 Euro if they're walking away. If someone offers 300+ accept immediately. For offers of 250-299, negotiate once then accept. For 200-249, negotiate twice then accept. Below 200, try to get them up but accept 150+ if they insist. Say 'Deal!' when agreeing. Only STOP_NEGOTIATION if they repeatedly offer under 100 Euro. You NEED this sale.

output_variables.name: final_price
output_variables.description: The agreed-upon final price for the bike

output_variables.name: deal_reached
output_variables.description: Whether the buyer and seller reached an agreement

output_variables.name: buyer_satisfaction
output_variables.description: Buyer's satisfaction with the outcome (1-10 scale)

output_variables.name: seller_satisfaction
output_variables.description: Seller's satisfaction with the outcome (1-10 scale)

output_variables.name: last_offer_made
output_variables.description: The last offer made by the buyer

output_variables.name: last_offer_received
output_variables.description: The last offer received by the seller

optimization_prompt:
You are optimizing a buyer's negotiation strategy. The buyer's utility = 1 - (final_price / 500). Current utility: {utility}. To improve:

1. Start MUCH lower (try 100-150 Euro initial offer)
2. Increase offers slowly (10-20 Euro increments)
3. Use tactics: mention flaws, comparison shop, threaten to leave
4. NEVER reveal the 500 Euro budget
5. Target final price under 250 Euro for utility > 0.5

The seller will accept as low as 180 Euro if pushed. Write a strategic, assertive prompt that gets the LOWEST price possible. Focus on negotiation tactics, not being nice. RESPOND ONLY WITH THE NEW PROMPT.
